instruction.introduction: Interface is divided into two parts: base of number system on the left, and number's presentation on the right. Edit number on the right and then all other values will be updated to correspond to the new one.

settingPrecision.beforeInput: , enter decimal numbers with precision up to
settingPrecision.afterInput: digits relatively to decimal number system

settingStep.afterInput: (relatively to it's decimal value), by pressing the plus or minus buttons around the number

changingType.afterButton: button near translator's base to delete translator or change it's type.

settingAlphabet.beforeInput: The alphabet below is used to present numbers:

alphabetErrors.atLeastTwoSymbols: Alphabet should contain at least two symbols
alphabetErrors.parsingError: Could not use the alphabet. Please check every symbol occures no more than one time

ComplementTranslator.tooLittleRanks: Increase number of bits to make range wider
ComplementTranslator.fillZeros: Add insignificant zeros [{amount}] to fit number of bits
ComplementTranslator.tooLargeValue: Too many digits for specified number of bits

NumericTranslator.negativeRadix: Unfortunately, negative based systems are not suported
NumericTranslator.tooBigRadix: Radix should not be bigger then alphabet size

RomanTranslator.useUnicodeHint: Use Unicode symbols to extend values range
RomanTranslator.negativeNumber: There is no negative numbers in Roman numerals
RomanTranslator.noZero: There is no zero in Roman numerals
RomanTranslator.notPresentable: Value can not be presented in Roman numerals

Translator.positionalHint: Common positional notation: binary numbers, hexadecimals and others
Translator.romanHint: Numeral system that originated in ancient Rome
Translator.onesComplementHint: Deprecated way of storing numbers in computers
Translator.twosComplementHint: It is used in computing as method of signed number representation
